lines.content: This is a project template for a greenfield Java project. It's named after the Java mascot _Duke_. Given below are instructions on how to use it.
Prerequisites: JDK 17, update Intellij to the most recent version.
1. Open Intellij (if you are not in the welcome screen, click `File` > `Close Project` to close the existing project first)
1. Open the project into Intellij as follows:
1. Select the project directory, and click `OK`.
1. If there are any further prompts, accept the defaults.
1. Configure the project to use **JDK 17** (not other versions) as explained in [here](https://www.jetbrains.com/help/idea/sdk.html#set-up-jdk).
In the same dialog, set the **Project language level** field to the `SDK default` option.

1. After that, locate the `src/main/java/AlphaOne.java` file, right-click it, and choose `Run AlphaOne.main()` (if the code editor is showing compile errors, try restarting the IDE). If the setup is correct, you should see something like the below as the output:

**Warning:** Keep the `src\main\java` folder as the root folder for Java files (i.e., don't rename those folders or move Java files to another folder outside of this folder path), as this is the default location some tools (e.g., Gradle) expect to find Java files.

* AlphaOne is the main application class that coordinates user input, parsing,
* It holds the application's {@code TaskList} and {@code Storage} instances and
* contains the interactive loop implemented in {@link #run()}.
public enum CommandType {BYE, LIST, UNMARK, MARK, DELETE, FIND}

* This method prints the welcome banner, loads any saved tasks from
* {@link alphaone.storage.Storage}, processes commands until the user
* issues the {@code bye} command, and then persists the task list.
System.out.println("Hello! I am AlphaOne, your chatbot companion!");
System.out.println("Tell me what you would like to do!");

* Program entry point that creates the application instance and runs it.
* Signals that a command required additional details (e.g. /by, /from, /to) that were missing.
* Create an IncompleteDetailsException indicating which task type was missing details.
* @param taskType the task type with incomplete details.
Please add in what you would like to do?
Please add in what you would like to do followed with /by to set the deadline.
Example: deadline write report /by tomorrow evening
Please add in what you would like to do followed with /from and /to to set the duration?
Example: event attend wedding on saturday /from 12pm /to 6pm
* Signals that a user command was invalid or malformed.
* Creates a generic invalid command exception with a default message.
* Creates an InvalidCommandException for a specific task type (e.g. TODO).
* @param taskType the task type that had a malformed command.
* Creates an InvalidCommandException for a specific command type (e.g. MARK).
* @param commandType the command type that was invalid.
Invalid TODO command! Please try again.
Invalid DEADLINE command! Please try again.
Invalid EVENT command! Please try again.
Invalid MARK command! Please try again.
Invalid UNMARK command! Please try again.
Invalid DELETE command! Please try again.
Invalid BYE command! No other parameters required.
Invalid LIST command! No other parameters required.
Invalid FIND command! Please enter keyword(s)
* Signals that a provided date/time string is invalid for the expected task type.
* Construct an InvalidDateTimeException indicating the task type that required
* @param taskType the type of task for which validation failed.
For Event tasks, use YYYY-MM-DD HHMM
* Indicates that a referenced task id does not exist in the task list.
* Creates the exception with a user-friendly message.
* Task that has an associated deadline date.
* Creates a Deadline with a description and a date string.
* @param deadline date string in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).
* Creates a Deadline from stored state.
* @param wasDone whether task was previously completed.

* Adds a new task of the specified type to the list.
* @param input the task description or primary input.
* @param type the task type to add (TODO, DEADLINE, EVENT).
* @param params optional additional parameters (e.g. date/time strings).
public void addTask(String input, alphaone.AlphaOne.TaskType type, String... params) {
case DEADLINE -> newTask = new Deadline(input, params[0]);
case EVENT -> newTask = new Event(input, params[0], params[1]);

* Utility class that provides parsing helpers for command-line input.
* The Parser contains small stateless helpers to split input tokens, join tokens
* from an index, validate date/time inputs and extract task descriptions and
* timings for deadline and event tasks.
* Splits raw user input into tokens separated by whitespace.
* @param input the raw input line provided by the user.
* @return an array of tokens extracted from {@code input}.
* Joins tokens from the provided start index to the end into a single string.
* @param tokens the array of tokens to join.
* @param start the index at which to begin joining (inclusive).
* @return the joined string, or an empty string if {@code start} is past the end.
public static String joinFromIndex(String[] tokens, int start) {
* Validates a date or datetime string according to the task type.
* If the format is invalid an {@link InvalidDateTimeException} is thrown.
* @param input the date/datetime string to validate.
* @param type the task type that determines expected format.
* @throws InvalidDateTimeException if {@code input} cannot be parsed for {@code type}.
public static void validateDate(String input, AlphaOne.TaskType type) throws InvalidDateTimeException {
* Extracts and validates description and date/time parts for deadline and event commands.
* For DEADLINE: expects input tokens to contain a "/by" marker. Returns [description, deadline].
* For EVENT: expects input tokens to contain "/from" and "/to" markers. Returns [description, from, to].
* @param commands the tokenised user input (first token is the command word).
* @param taskType the task type to parse (DEADLINE or EVENT).
* @return an ArrayList of strings containing parsed segments as described above.
* @throws InvalidCommandException if required markers are missing or misplaced.
* @throws IncompleteDetailsException if required segments are empty.
* @throws InvalidDateTimeException if any date/time segment fails validation.
public static ArrayList<String> descriptionPrep(String[] commands, AlphaOne.TaskType taskType) throws InvalidCommandException, IncompleteDetailsException, InvalidDateTimeException {
* Handles persistence for the application by reading/writing tasks to a text file.
* The Storage class reads a simple line-based serialization and reconstructs
* task objects. It is robust to malformed lines and will skip invalid entries.
* Loads tasks from the storage file and rebuilds an in-memory task map.
* @return a HashMap mapping integer identifiers to Task instances. If no
*         file exists an empty map is returned.

// Event expects type, done, description, start, end

* Persists the provided task map to the storage file, replacing its contents.
* @param taskList the task map to persist; keys and order are retained.
* Simple console-based UI helper for reading input and rendering the app logo.
* This class centralizes a scanner used by the application and exposes a
* convenience method to fetch lines from standard input and the application
private static final java.util.Scanner scanner = new java.util.Scanner(System.in);
* Read a single line from standard input.
* @return the next line from System.in (without the line terminator)
* Return the ASCII-art logo used at application startup.
REM create bin directory if it doesn't exist
REM delete output from previous run
REM compile the code into the bin folder
REM run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
REM compare the output to the expected output
# create bin directory if it doesn't exist
# compile the code into the bin folder, terminates if error occurred
# run the program, feed commands from input.txt file and redirect the output to the ACTUAL.TXT
# normalize CRLF -> LF using tr (portable on macOS)
# remove lines that exactly match any input commands (so echoed inputs don't cause mismatches)
# remove trailing whitespace from each line to avoid failures caused by insignificant spacing
# use sed -E (portable on macOS) to trim trailing spaces/tabs
# trim trailing blank lines and ensure exactly one trailing newline on each cleaned file
awk '{lines[NR]=$0} END{n=NR; while(n>0 && lines[n]=="") n--; for(i=1;i<=n;i++) print lines[i]} ' "$f" > "$f".tmp
# compare the cleaned outputs (unified diff for easier debugging)
